poem:
**Mind the Gap**

In rooms of thought, the cost ascends,  
as minds unravel and threads fray.  
An echo chamber of need and means,  
where solace wears a price tag today.  
The labyrinth of the mind mapped out,  
in twelve steps—each a gilded stair,  
while outside, the queue extends,  
and quiet desperation hangs in the air.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Cost of private psychology soars in UK as practitioners turn away clients The cost of seeing private psychologists is soaring and many are so busy they are turning away new clients, research has found. The prices psychologists charge have risen by 34% since 2022 and 12 sessions now cost an average of £1,550, compared with £1,152 just three years ago, according to a survey by myTribe Insurance, which tracks the cost of private medical care.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Cost of private psychology soars in UK as practitioners turn away clients The cost of seeing private psychologists is soaring and many are so busy they are turning away new clients, research has found. The prices psychologists charge have risen by 34% since 2022 and 12 sessions now cost an average of £1,550, compared with £1,152 just three years ago, according to a survey by myTribe Insurance, which tracks the cost of private medical care.
